meanings.definition: White blood cells that help the body fight infection.
meanings.sent1: Leukocytes are like tiny soldiers protecting our bodies from germs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can check the number of leukocytes in your blood to see if you have an infection.
meanings.sent3: The leukocytes in our body are the real heroes fighting off the bad guys.
meanings.sent4: In the battle against illness, leukocytes are the brave defenders standing strong.
meanings.sent5: Imagine leukocytes as the courageous warriors battling viruses inside you.

meanings.definition: A type of blood cell that plays a key role in the immune system.
meanings.sent1: Leukocytes are like the guardians of our immune system, always ready to protect us.
meanings.sent2: When you get sick, your body produces more leukocytes to help you get better.
meanings.sent3: The leukocytes in our blood are the vigilant protectors of our health.
meanings.sent4: Just like superheroes, leukocytes swoop in to save the day when we're under attack.
meanings.sent5: The immune system relies on leukocytes to be the frontline defenders against invaders.
